intro: Voacanga schweinfurthii var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered African legume, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces woody pods containing elliptical seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been the subject of various phytochemical studies.
